history.content:
Dr.Shafi Goldwasser is giving a talk at the Newton Lecture Series TONIGHT (Tuesday 11/19) at 6:30pm in Li Ka Shing Auditorium! She is the Director of the Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing, and a professor of computer science at UC Berkeley. She is also the RSA Professor of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at MIT, and a professor of computer science and applied mathematics at the Weizmann Institute of Science in Israel.  

Her pioneering work has revolutionized cryptography and helped create the foundations for zero-knowledge proofs used to advance digital technologies like blockchain and cryptocurrencies. Dr. Goldwasser received the ACM Turing Award in 2012 (considered to be the Nobel Award of computing), and has been awarded the ACM Grace Murray Hopper Award, the ACM Athena Ward for women in computer science, the IEEE Piore Award and many more.  You can read more about her work in a recent article in the MIT Technology Review. 


More information about the talk can be found at https://scet.berkeley.edu/newton-series/fall-2019-series/
history.subject: Shafi Goldwasser Talk TONIGHT at 6:30pm in Li Ka Shing Auditorium
